term.label: Axis step
term.definition: An axis step has an axis which specifies a direction of travel in the node tree in relation to the context node, such as parent:: or child::. It also specifies a node test, which defines the nodes to select using the node name or type.

term.label: Constructor function
term.definition: The constructor function for a given type is used to convert instances of other atomic types into the given type.

term.label: Context item
term.definition: The item, an atomic value or node, currently being processed. When the context item is a node, it is also called the context node.

term.label: Context position
term.definition: The position of the context item in the sequence of items being processed. The position changes whenever the context item changes, and is used to evaluate a predicate such as para[1]. The position() function may be used to return its value.

term.label: Current dateTime.
term.definition: An implementation-dependent point in time, which can be retrieved by the current-dateTime() function. If called more than once during the execution of a stylesheet, this function always returns the same result.

term.label: Filter expression
term.definition: A primary expression, such as a literal, variable reference or function call, followed by zero or more predicates. The result consists of the items returned by the primary expression, filtered by applying each predicate in turn.

term.label: Implicit timezone.
term.definition: An implementation-defined value of type xs:dayTimeDuration to be used when a date, time, or dateTime value that does not have a timezone is used in a comparison or arithmetic operation.

term.label: Node
term.definition: One of the node types defined in XPath 2.0, for example document, element, or attribute.

term.label: Path expression
term.definition: An expression used to locate nodes within trees, which consists of one or more steps, separated by "/" or "//".

term.label: Predicate
term.definition: An expression contained in square brackets [] that filters the nodes selected in an step expression.

term.label: Primary expressions
term.definition: Expressions that are the basic primitives of the XPath language such as a literal, variable reference or function call.

term.label: Sequence
term.definition: An ordered collection of zero or more items.

term.label: Step
term.definition: Part of a path expression that generates a sequence of items and then filters the sequence by zero or more predicates. A step may be either an axis step or a filter expression.

term.label: Variable reference
term.definition: A variable reference is a QName specified in an xsl:variable or xsl:param element, and referred to in an XPath expression. It is preceded by a $ sign to distinguish it from a reference to a source document element name.
